<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Gorilla Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=1733) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=152" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 128 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 4)

</column>

---

You lower yourself to the ground and take an imposing, knuckle-walking stance. While in this stance, the only Strikes you can make are gorilla slam unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage; are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group; and have the [backswing](/Traits.aspx?ID=173), [forceful](/Traits.aspx?ID=180), [grapple](/Traits.aspx?ID=184), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) traits. While you are in Gorilla Stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) checks to [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=33), and if you roll a success on an Athletics check to Climb, you get a critical success instead.

<title level="2">Gorilla Stance leads to...</title>
[Gorilla Pound](/Feats.aspx?ID=1741)
name: Gorilla Stance
